intro: Stomatium loganii, commonly known as the Logan's stomata plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Stomatium loganii is noted for its unique stomatal structures, which play a crucial role in its adaptation to high-altitude environments.
